column4: make sure you have satisfied all of the prequesites (sounds like you are missing kernel sources)
i have extracted the kernel source in /usr/src/ do I need to make install that or what? its just a folder right now
no
whatever you are doing is probably wrong btw
I finally got the make part to work and it said "Type 'make config' and enable loadable module support.Then build a kernel with module support enabled." that is why I am trying to build a new kernel.

like i said, whatever you are doing is probably wrong.  1. there is almost 0 reason to compile a kernel on an ubuntu system, 2. you are supposed to compile a kernel using kpkg and other debian/ubuntu specific mechanisms or things are going to go badly.
well I need this omnibook module so I can get my fn keys to work on my toshiba it says MODULE support is disabled what else am I suppose to do?
have you bothered to search the forum, launchpad, or the wiki?  A basic search yields quite a few relevant results
yes I have and all of them say to do it this way make install on the omnibook module and thats where I am at right now...so please stop making it sound like I am dumb
actually the first link i'm looking at says to use module-assistant
and yes I have tried that as well and that results in Errors and doesn't build right
so why not diagnose those errors?
because it doesn't produce a log file at all so I can figure out what the errors are it says it does and I go to where it says and there is no log file

wget http://packages.kirya.net/debian/pool/main/o/omnibook/omnibook-source_2.20070211+svn20090227-1_all.deb; dpkg -i omnibook*.deb ; sudo module-assistant build omnibook ; sudo module-assistant install omnibook; sudo modprobe omnibook; sudo -i ; echo omnibook >> /etc/modules
doesn't work?
will try exactly what you put right now and tell you where and what exactly it says if fail k
those are the directions from the first google link..

okay I got to sudo module-assistant install omnibook....and I got this .... "Package omnibook-source was not built successfully, see /var/cache/modass/omnibook-source*buildlog* for details!" and I went to that place and there is no log file.
so?
follow the rest of the commands I gave you?
I can't it won't install though it says its not built right and then the modeprob part doesn't work
did you install build-essential
i just checked thats already installed
